text: I don't remember in which part of the game did this track play.
author: Kookosbanaani94

text: The soundtrack is so freakin' amazing! Too bad the game itself couldn't live up to its predecessor. The levels were far too open and dictated by RNG, it felt less like some kind of elaborate puzzle, and more like it required twitch reflexes and luck.
author: Ozziw162

text: So...you need good reflexes to go guns blazing.
author: cralo

text: Definitely favorite track along with Roller Mobster
author: fatjoe460

text: I love the beginning. Sounds like Ecco The Dolphin
author: symir547

text: One of Perturbator's best works, imo. When that beat starts up at 1:10, just... God, it's good.
author: Gamer 2: Gamer No More

text: I was so very hyped for the sequel, and when it came out I did play through it within the first day - it was fantastic stuff, really. Although I do feel that I had more fun with the first, and I don't know why. I don't know if it was more challenging, more varied, or just had a more sporadic story, but something didn't click with me with the sequel.
author: Drazzan

text: Thanks for the good words in the 50k video, it's truly appreciated! Having loved the first game, I was happy to get more of it with this sequel. The soundtrack is much bigger and full of quality tracks, but I do have to admit that it didn't have the same staying power the first game's music had with me. Still, some tracks were definitely memorable.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky Exact opposite for me! Although I adore both soundtracks.
author: Michael

text: +SlothfulCynic Yeah I agree with you. The Way Home is probably the best track from both OSTs imo
author: FuzzyPeachMan
